Upgrade to RHEL 7 12th April 2017

  1. Create change controls, business approvals and all the things of that sort.
  2. Shutdown applications.
  3. Plan with VMWARE team and perform a VMWARE snapshot
    1. Shutdown the OS
    2. Take a cold snapshot â€“ Wintel
    3. Power the system back on
  4. Login to the client
  5. Modify the local.repo file with the latest repository. First make a copy
    sudo cp /etc/yum.repos.d/local.repo local.repo

    Add this 

    cat << EOF | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/local.repo
[04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-rpms]
name=04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-rpms
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-rpms
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_

[04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-extras-rpms]
name=04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-extras-rpms
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-extras-rpms
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_

[04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-optional-rpms]
name=04-12-2017-rhel-7-server-optional-rpms
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-7-server-optional-rpms
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_

[local-tenneco-noarch]
name=local-tenneco-noarch
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/tenneco-noarch/
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_

[local-tenneco-nbu]
name=local-tenneco-nbu
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/nbuclient/
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_
EOF
  6. On SAP App servers modify the sap.repo with the latest repository.First make a copy
    sudo cp /etc/yum.repos.d/sap.repo sap.repo

    Add this 

    cat << EOF | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/sap.repo
[04-12-2017-rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms]
name=04-12-2017-rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms
baseurl=http://pablsv02/sources/04-12-2017/rhel-sap-for-rhel-7-server-rpms
enabled=1
gpgcheck=0
proxy=_none_
EOF
  7. Install the updates / patches.
    sudo yum clean all
sudo yum update
  8. Reboot the server
    sudo init 6
